line.text: Whilst I alone did call upon thy aid
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: My verse alone had all thy gentle grace
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But now my gracious numbers are decayed
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And my sick muse doth give an other place
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: I grant (sweet love) thy lovely argument
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Deserves the travail of a worthier pen
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Yet what of thee thy poet doth invent
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: He robs thee of and pays it thee again
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: He lends thee virtue and he stole that word
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: From thy behaviour beauty doth he give
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And found it in thy cheek he can afford
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: No praise to thee but what in thee doth live
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Then thank him not for that which he doth say
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Since what he owes thee thou thy self dost pay
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
